timeline.bodyText: where/how are we using this example.com/client_id? do we need a such value as default or is the caller expected to always specify a value?
timeline.author: havetisyan

replies.bodyText:
Auth0 has restriction on custom field format, so we need the "https://myapp.example.com/" part as the namespace.
https://auth0.com/docs/api-auth/tutorials/adoption/scope-custom-claims#custom-claims
Also, as we enforced the client ID and cnf checking in the new authority class, the claim name should be specified. For the default value, I just use the value can be found in auth0's docs.

timeline.bodyText: why did we create this class? we already have the SigningKeyResolver without relying on auth0 implementation and it supports both rsa and ec keys. So rather than creating yet another and adding dependency on auth0 library, take a look at the current key resolver and if necessary extend that class.
timeline.author: havetisyan

replies.bodyText:
As the auth0 class has built-in refresh logic on the JWKS URL, I included the library. However, its behavior is difficult to trace in operation so I updated to depend on the existing JwtsSigningKeyResolver in 591d10e.
I also made some changes on the JwtsSigningKeyResolver class to support file URL.
In addition, as the 2 classes behave differently, I just use weak dependency. Please let me know if extending the class is better.
